title: If I say the last line of the tashahhud while standing up due to being in a hurry is prayer valid?
transcript:
[Questioner] from the U.S so my question was 
if I said the last line of the tashahud while   standing up due to being in a hurry is the prayer 
valid if you've done this intentionally meaning   that the shahud is compromised of a number of 
sentences so if you say to the end of his stood up   and while standing up you said if you've done 
this deliberately their prayer is invalid   because this the shahud should have been done 
while sitting down and doing it while standing   up you are deliberately skipping it and skipping 
something that is mandatory breaks your Salah   if you've done this out of ignorance or 
forgetfulness or you were absent-minded and   discovered that already after you stood up then 
you have to compensate this with sujud asahu two   prostrations of forgetfulness before Salam if 
you did not offer this as well because you did   not know that this was the ruling inshallah 
your prayer is valid and Allah Knows Best and have you ever taken a counseling session with 
me go to my website and you will find counseling   sessions and apply for one if you can afford it 
that's good for you if you cannot you're entitled   for one free session and this is for everybody 
if they can affirm by Allah that they cannot   afford it because they're poor I'll give them 
one free session without a problem a full half   an hour so come to me and let's speak about 
it inshallah within the following two days   or three days I will uh try and seek Allah's 
guidance to solve the problem once and for All
